log.content: Create me a website about 3d printers. Make it technical and informative, including information such as calibration, what process should be followed after changing filament etc. Add lots of detail and use a modern design language with the main color being orange. You should create multiple pages, but make sure the main page is available in index.html

function.name: create_file
create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"index.html","content":" 3D Printing Technical Guide

3D Printing Technical Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change

Welcome to the 3D Printing Technical Guide

This site provides detailed technical information about 3D printers, including calibration procedures and best practices for filament management.

Main Sections

  • Calibration Guide - Learn how to calibrate your 3D printer for optimal performance.
  • Filament Change Process - Step-by-step instructions for changing filament mid-print or during maintenance.

© 2023 3D Printing Technical Guide

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"Calibration.html","content":" Calibration Guide

3D Printing Technical Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change

Calibration Guide

Bed Leveling

Bed leveling ensures the print surface is flat and at the correct height relative to the nozzle. Use a piece of paper to test the gap between the nozzle and bed. Adjust the bed screws until the paper is slightly resistant when pulled through.

Extruder Calibration

Calibrate the extruder steps to ensure accurate filament extrusion. Use a ruler to measure extruded filament length and adjust the steps/mm in the printer's firmware.

Temperature Tuning

Test extrusion temperatures for different filaments. Start with the manufacturer's recommended temperatures and adjust by ±5°C as needed for better flow or adhesion.

© 2023 3D Printing Technical Guide

"}

function.name: create_file
function.arguments:
{"file_name":"FilamentChange.html","content":" Filament Change Process

3D Printing Technical Guide

Home Calibration Filament Change

Filament Change Process

Steps to Change Filament:

  1. Preheat the extruder to the current filament's temperature.
  2. Unload the old filament by manually retracting it or using the printer's unload function.
  3. Load the new filament into the extruder, ensuring it feeds smoothly.
  4. Purge the nozzle by extruding about 10cm of filament to remove any residue from the old material.
  5. Check the first layer adhesion and adjust bed leveling if needed.

For mid-print filament changes, pause the print, change the filament, and resume. Ensure the new filament matches the required temperature profile.

© 2023 3D Printing Technical Guide

"}
